text: Order took 2 hours to get here. When it finally did, pizza was cold. Delivery guy said that it wasn't paid for, even though I paid online. First and last time I order from here.

The delivery took over 2 hours to get to my home. They called repeatedly because they were out of multiple things, like chicken. I was extremely frustrated when I, expecting no more than an hour wait as advertised, that I could eat and then rest before heading to bed. Instead the food came with missing foods. What a waste of time.

Poor Customer service 
I called in a pizza order since we were out in that area, figured we would pick it up on the way home. The girl I spoke too on the phone took the order and told me 20 min, We show up 20 min later and our pizza is bearly going into the oven, I asked the guy at the counter why was I told 20 min by the girl who took my order on the phone. The little  blonde girl behind him chimes in we don't expect ppl to be here in 20 min they usually don't show up for about 40 min. Very un professional.

We ended up receiving this flyer at the house and decided to try it one of the best choices we made. Such friendly staff the food was so tasty! We ordered a 10 inch supreme pizza which was delicious,  huge pepperonis are on it the Philly steaks were delicious they came with free fries and a drink which was a plus. Definitely will come back!
This place is gret to visit with famili and friends! Friendly stuff best food fast delivery! Been here many times and will be back soon thank you guys!

being from philly i'm always on the lookout for a good cheesesteak. this place has it. also bought a hoagie for a friend who said it was great. a great sandwich starts with a great roll. they have great rolls. they have only been open a couple of months and once the word gets out they are gonna take off. I ordered to go but they have plenty of seating with a separate dining area. I can predict lines around the corner to get into this place.

I love the people that works there and the food.  The Philly Cheese Steak is great and the pizza is a lot like back east. The best part is that they have great customer service.  Always smiling and friendly.

Joe Phillys used to be our favorite pizza spot, but when the ownership changed the quality went down the toilet. The family atmosphere is gone and the new owners are surly and rude. The pizza is doughy and disgusting. Everything else tastes like it came frozen in a bag, if they could ship their pizza in premade I'm sure they would. Frankly, the customers who never receive their food are the lucky ones.

They have good food. There food is very well priced almost everything is under 10$. I had lunch here with 2 other people and it was good, but if you are looking for a fancy pizza place this is not it. This joint is average but customer service is nice and they were helpful.

GR8 customer service...even though it was delivery...they ran out of their chocolate cake so they gave me an extra slice of dessert...There pepperoni pizza is YUMMY 2 MY TUMMY...LOVED iT!!! And the hot wings were good too....everything was good....THANK YOU!!!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon, they have really good specials and were very accommodating when we wanted substitutions. Pizza was great, fried ravioli was excellent! Four stars cause the fries were a little dry but great overall I'll be returning here regularly! :)
first time ordering fast delivery and food was godd. I will be calling agian.

Ordered for delivery. Waited 2 1/2 hours and never got my food. Worst place ever. This place doesn't even deserve my time to play a review except to warn people of its piss poor service. If I could give it negative stars I will. Thanks for waisting my time.

The pizza was good but cold due to it being delivered an hour late. I understand getting lost but being unable to follow directions over the phone and asking to walk up the road to meet the driver is a bit frustrating.

Delicious! Best word I can use to give justice. Saturday night, delivery, they did not disappoint. They got here super fast and the food was great in both quality and flavor. Our pizza was loaded with all the toppings, lots of cheese! Bless them for packing our caesar dressing separate from the salad so it doesn't get soggy. I must mention they did not skimp on the condiments
People, service, and food are excellent! I ordered for work and EVERYTHING was gone which is unusual here. And they keep asking for it again. I definitely recommend!

Yummy pizza and cheese sticks at 330 in the am and the guy behind the counter was a perfect gentleman will definitely have to return the next time we're in vegas!!!  Came back in November for Vegas vacation 2 still bomb a$$ pizza any time of day. This time was at 2:30

We got to Vegas on a late flight so we were tired and wanted something quick. When we got to the hotel, the front desk person recommended this place.  The delivery was fast,  the food was good and the prices were very very reasonable. We liked it so much we ordered again before leaving to the airport. Very good!

This place is a diamond in the rough. Fantastic food, plenty of parking,  and clean. The owner bill is the nicest guy to talk with and always wants you to have a great meal.  Real east coast pizza, even with the so called bad water in Las Vegas. .... Highly recommended,  if you don't like this place, you hate eating out!!!

Ate from here today... ordered a Chicago Dog, which was pretty bad. The "hot"dog was cold. On the other hand, I also had the chili cheese fries and cheese cake, which were both awesome! I've eaten here before and the pizza is also the bomb! The Chi-dog was the only bad experience. Will definately try out more on the menu!

We ordered the Philly sandwich (husband said it was good) and also had a White Pizza.  The fries could use some work.  They tasted very greasy like the oil needed changing or something.  It was greasy and brown.  Yuck.  The pizza was just "okay".  The reason I say that is because I'm a garlic lover and the garlic tasted a little off, like maybe they are using bottled garlic or something.  Staff are super friendly and nice. Hope they make it.
Super good pizza place. My friend and I order at least once or twice a week around 2-4am and it's always worth the wait. We love jOE PHILLYS!!!

They literally didn't give me part of my order. Paid for something and didn't get it. They knew what I ordered and still left out part of it. They never called to correct the mistake or apologize, and it is impossible for them to have not noticed.
The driver refused to deliver the food to our tower. Husband was hopping mad and will be disputing the $73 credit card charge.

I ordered a special which was a pepperoni pizza chicken strips and fries and a 2liter.  Ther ordered arrived 2 hrs and 20 mins late tried to cancel after the first hour abdbtgey jusdt kept putting me on hold.  The food was cold soggy and horribly bland!! My kids wouldn't  even eat it.  The driver was rude after being 2hrs late!! I wish I could give therm 0 stars and get my $35 back.  Don't waste your time or money.

We're so excited that we found a great, locally owned pizza place by our house.  We ordered for the second time this evening.  Our first time we got the buffalo chicken pizza, mozzarella sticks, and jalapeno poppers.  Tonight we got the BBQ chicken pizza, mozzarella sticks, and chicken fingers.  I highly recommend all of these items.  They were all amazingly delicious!  The staff is super nice and delivery is fast!  I love this place!

It's a great place. Food is very good. The pizza is amazing. Staff is very friendly and good customer service. I highly recommend this place. They have separate area that you can have parties. Also the prices are very reasonable.

Seriously, taking a pizza order is not challenging.  The lady at the register had her mind on something other than pizza.  I guess listening is a lost art when the restaurant isn't busy.  Have your workers say hi, the pizza cook made eye contact with me and held it, didn't say anything and was emotionless and Felt awkward.  He rinsed his hands with water for 10 seconds and did NOT use soap.  And still proceeded to make the pizza.  No wonder I walked out LOL!!!

They should be inspected by the health department!

Come here often. Pizza in very good, east coast style, the calzone and stromboli are a regular item I order and have not been dissatisfied.  The family that owns the place is friendly and eager to make your dining experience pleasant.  A great switch from the mass produced cardboard pizza from the chains in vegas.

This place has a good dine in place but it's definitely food you should order cause it's freaking AWESOMEEEEEE !!!!!!!!! The customer service is fantastic! They gave me great deals  and a lot of food !! Definitely should try the PHILLY CHEESE STEAK ! It's realllllllllyyyyy goooooddd ! I've been looking for a place like this too remind me of Chicago pizza and Chicago style cheese steak and this is definitely the place for it !!! Highly recommend !!!

BEST Burgers in Vegas!
 Sometimes, I need a badass burger and I need it delivered to my door looking like a television commercial and giving me flavor-wise what I want out of the Vegas foodie scene. I have found such burger. It's at Joe's. Seasoned and perfectly cooked burger covered in bbq sauce, bacon and a whole mixture of goodness. Fries were crispy! Delivery was fast and polite!  Service is excellent when you call in too, which I appreciate very much.

Worst delivery service ever!!!! Don't waste your time!!! First of all they not deliver our item. We waited over 90 minutes and still nothing. When we called they said "oh it's in the way...yeah it never showed. My friend ended up canceling the order but the restaurant is refusing to refund her money!! Talk about poor business ethics. Shame on you.

Place used to good, dunno what happened. Dirty/dusty/greasy floors, out of fries, soda machine had no syrup, burnt out light bulbs, and it smells like fabuloso. Don't see this place staying open pretty long. So long Joe Philthy's.

Avoid like the plague. New owners. Don't let them scam you out of your money. Would rate a zero. Quality of food is terrible, over cooked, greasy, and incomplete. Management has zero customer service, rude doesn't accept responsibility. Food is complete garbage and so is the management. Be smart stay away.


Shortly after this review the "Owner" contacted me wanting to get my side of the story after speaking with the "manager". Largely motivated to find a solution so he could have me remove the photos and change my review. 

I told him I would consider it if the "manager" wrote a thoughtful apology and fully admitted to his actions and took accountability. 

The "manager" did. I've posted a picture of the apology for everyone to see that the quality of the apology amazingly reflects the quality of service and food they are selling, ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE!

Fool me once shame on you. Fool me twice shame on you again.

Do not give these people your money, you're money would be better served flushed down a drain!
Pizza was alright. Worst garlic knots I've ever had. Tasted like expired bread with pliant owner on it

This place is amazing, the food tastes fresh and delicious.... great place to visit with family and kid (s). The delivery guys are super nice and fast. I would like to thank Daniel ( delivery Driver) because his always fast and cheerful. His hard working men. Thank you "Joe Phillie's Pizzas"  whole staff. Great TEAM!!!!!!

This place should really have more stars. I would always get this pizza during the late hours of the night since their hours are conducive to the gaming industry. You should be able to grab a pizza for less than ten dollars and it will fill you up along with a couple buddies.

I am so excited this pizza is true philly pizza. Tastes better than anywhere in Vegas. 

I give it five stars with one caveat. The bottom side of the crust was 60-70% pitch black. I don't know if that is how its supposed to be done, or if that happens when you reheat slices, or if the oven is simply just not clean. It tasted slightly like burnt toast, but overall i am very happy to have found this place. It still gets 5 stars.

Also, they really do have the best cheesesteak in town. And, they always serve you just out of the fryer nice and hot  french fries.

Great late night philly. Cheesy, peppers, onions and mushrooms all on a great roll. Came with fries and a drink for under 10$. 
Can not go wrong here, get some!
The burgers are on point! My friend and I just finished our meal and it was amazing. We will be ordering from here again. Reasonable delivery time as well!

I was so hungry and this was the perfect fix! Fettuccini alfredo was an amazing flavor, chocolate cake was like a heavenly brownie, garlic knots held over for 3 days and I feel like they got better every day. Wings were so good my husband barely let me have any! Definitely ordering from here again.
Poor tasting since it got new ownership! Was a solid 4/5 a little over year ago! We changed pizza places!
Holy yum. This place is Karma Sutra in my mouth. Everything I got was orgasmic. Don't think twice! Just try it.

Ordered late night delivery and they estimated 45 minutes. I called them after over an hour and they said the driver was leaving now. I called after an hour and half to cancel and the guy was a dick. Rather eat Ramen late at night than deal with these guys. Stay away!

Placed the order at midnight, pizza showed 45 minutes later. The person on the phone was very friendly. No complaints with the food, honestly more very surprised at how good it is for almost being 1 in the morning.

Great pizza and food in general. Been here a few times and it's for a reason. Service is great and the employees are very attentive and helpful. Like this place so much we used it to cater a lunch for my company's event.

I've eaten here twice and the food is really good although the service isn't really great. The deliver driver the first time was very rude and the second time we ordered a ceasar salad and a sandwich and it took over an HOUR to get delivered

Good Philly cheese steaks and fries, friendly service are the plus points for this place,  I also ordered their pepperoni pizza and the 4pc fried chicken. Both the chicken and pizza are not recommended. The pizza had cheap ingredients and it was oily, if they used higher quality cheese and pepperoni it would have been much better. The fried chicken was just nasty, it had an off flavor to it and the chicken was fatty.  I hope the owners are reading these reviews so they can make the changes they need to.

I have tried this place a few times being quite mediocre at best. Being the only pizza  place open till midnight you would think you really can't complain. However I called trying to place an order and was placed on hold for over ten minutes. I hung up and called back and the guy answered like it wasn't even busy. I then told him I wanted to place an order for delivery he asked me to give him a minute and put me on hold again for another 5 minutes. After waiting they picked up the phone(I could hear background noise) and then hung up. I honestly have never been to a place so resistant to take my money for a mediocre product.
Some of if not the best pizza I've found in Vegas. Good crust, great cheese, and awesome sause! Skip the wings & the fries, nothing special. Stick with the pizza.

First of, ive bought pizza and wings in here via walk in, as i love their pizza but this morning at work around 12:50am i put an order for delivery and left a note saying to contact my supervisor at this number that i provided and they said it will be delayed and will be delivered at 2:15am, so it was okay as that is by far the time where my team and crew goes to lunch break, but unfortunately me and my supervisor was keeping in touch if the delivery guy already called him as it is already pass 2:15am, i gave it a couple more time but it passes 3am already and i had enough of it, i took my lunch as I am really hungry already so is my workmates, we lost appetite and i have to call them up and it is one of my worst experience ever via delivery, they told me on the phone that the delivery guy is calling a number that starts with 417 area code and nobody is answering so he went back to the store with the food, i dont even know what area code is that, that is not the number i provided as the number i provided was on the receipt after they redeliver my order and got the food 3:50 in the morning, me and my team was not happy with what happen, it clearly says on the receipt to call my supervisor and the number was there, i know its hard to work graveyard as that is the same shift i work, but i gave my best as well as my whole team at work to be focus and look at the details, how hard could it be to look at the receipt...we all feel like whatever they said is just an excuse for their mistakes, i wasnt happy at all it is my first time ordering from them and get it delivered and unfortunately, i wont place delivery from them again, prolly stop by and walkin to buy only because of a good tasting pizza.
I tried this place out for the first time today. Super friendly staff, convenient location, TV to watch football, and THE BEST philly cheese steak I have ever had in Las Vegas.
Pizza undercooked as fuck. If I could give zero I would. Worst pizza in my entire life. April P hates it.

LIKE OMG  SOOOOOOOO GOOD!!!!! I just got a large mushroom  pizza  and it was sooooooo good. Pizza hut, dominos, etc. is disgusting with no cheese etc.  This is the first time I have tried this place and I am SOLD!! Im sorry I do not have a picture. I ate most of the pizza too fast lol

I'm from the east coast so I have a high standard for any place that uses Philly or New York in their pizza establishment. Joe Philly's hasn't been open a long time but since I discovered them it has been the only pizza place I go to.  Good pizza is hard to come by in Vegas so I am greatful to have them since it brings me back to the quality of pizza I grew up with.  The staff is always friendly and the place is clean as well. 
      Also one time me and a couple friends ordered pizza and the owner gave us each a free dessert. It's not something he had to do but I feel it speaks to the type of business he is running. Check this place out,  you will be glad you did

I am  visiting in town and decided to use uber eats for the first time as we had a long day and wanted to stay in. This was one of the most disappointing experiences I've had. The restaurants lack of concern from the way they packed the food to the burnt garlic bread that was as hard as a rock and the 4 missing side salads that were supposed to come with my dinner as well as the 2 liter of soda for my hungry children was appalling. I can't believe with such convenience to gain tourists business they would have such a lack of concern with fulfilling an extremely easy order as all 4 dinners were the same exact thing. Needless to say I sent my dry pasta back with uber driver as all the sauce was at the bottom of the bag. Luckily pizza was 1/2 way decent so I could feed my 2 children who had been swimming for the past couple hours and were starving. Uber eats driver was very gracious to take my food back and pick up fresh pasta with sauce on it not in the bag. Uber's driver was great but restaurant really needs to reevaluate the quality of service provided to their customer. This is nothing more than below the line behavior.

Went here tonight with a friend. Our first time there. We ordered a meat lovers pizza and as my friend was eating a slice, he pulled a hair out of the pizza. We didn't know hair was a meat product.  We didn't finish the rest and just threw it away. We'll never go back again.

I was in the mood for chicken wings while at work, so I jumped on Yelp. Searched the nearest spots, read the reviews like I usually do before I order anywhere. I wanted to try it out, got a couple of my coworkers to search the menu. I ordered fried calamari and the 8 pc bbq chicken wings. While my coworkers ordered the fish and chips, which the menu states it includes a garden salad and garlic bites. After making the order and receiving it upon delivery, I noticed that there were no garlic bites or garden salad, and they ran out of blue cheese. I called the restaurant back and explained to him these things were not included with the fish and chips, he says oh that's not even suppose to be on the menu and I'm sending my driver back with your salads. Bottom line, the food, quality of the bbq wings were horrible, tasted old, the wings were hard, the calamari was soggy, the fish and fries my coworkers told me were more of batter and the fries were hard. Never ordering from here again.

Few days ago we had a bday party at this fantastic place. The quality of food was soooo deliciouse and owner let us play music we likeI hightly recommend the "Armenian pizza" very deliciouse combination of cheese pizzas and fresh basil

Ordered with ubereats, uber driver had to wait at restaurant entire time food was being made.  It took double the time listed to get food. Ordered two wraps, one with dressing on side, they both came dry with no dressing for it. Calamari was limp and soggy,  jalapeno poppers... nothing to write home about.
Philly and storm was amazing and the delivery person was super nice.  I would highly recommend if you are in the area.

Yum! Decided to try out Joe Philly's and was impressed. Their Burgers and pizza are bomb. Generous portions and fair prices. Food arrived quick and hot. We also received a free 2 liter with our order. Will definitely order from here again.

My friend and I just picked up food from there. We ordered Philly cheesecakes, fries and drinks, to go. All I can say is: WOW! 

The service was GREAT! The woman who waited on us was super friendly and very personable. Atmosphere was very welcoming. The food was excellent and we are planning on eating here again before we leave. Wonderful Las Vegas memory :-)

Ordered the 16 inch cheese pizza and it was okay. The pizza sauce lacks flavor, oilier than most pizza I have tried and the cheese is acceptable. The crust was good. Please consider adding parmesean cheese to enhance the flavor profile overall. Let it cool down after doing so and then enjoy.  

The fries order were with Bay Seasoning and had they been lightly seasoned, they would have rocked. The fries are crispy and not oily.

Will give this establishment another go when wanting to order.
Like always the pizza is good and this time tried the turkey and cheese sub. This is one of my kids favorite spots to get pizza. Prices are fair.

Ugh!! This is the second time we ordered from here and they got the order wrong again!  They forgot our mozz sticks and drink.  The last time we ordered ravioli and they gave us burnt stuffed shells.  The first time we ordered from this place it seemed really promising. I loved the spaghetti with olive oil and parm which is why I tried them a couple more times.  Now I don't think I will order from them again.  The order is on your screen.  It shouldn't be constantly wrong.  Usually I don't sound as mad in reviews but I can't help it.  I even called them to correct what they made a mistake with but as soon as the guy called he said "Hi, can I put you on hold" then proceeded to swear for the next 30 seconds.  These guys don't have a hold option so I heard EVERYTHING. They also started to dial on the same phone that I was on like they forgot I was even there.  I've worked in food service and this is inexcusable.  This joint is completely unprofessional. I will not be ordering from them again.  They eventually redelivered again but only when I messaged Eat24. When the missing items from the order arrived, it wasn't even worth it.

I ordered delivery last night. It was terrible. My salad had dried carrots and the dressing wasn't even the Italian dressing I ordered. It looked like 1000 Island. My pizza was suppose to be thin crust and it was regular crust. The pizza was cold and lacked any good flavor. It had a weird smell. The bag that my napkins were in smelled like fish. I should have just gone to the store and spent $10 instead of $30 and still was left making dinner. So much for ordering in while doing decorations.
Delicious !!! it is the most delicious pizza of all that I have ever eaten!!! Thank you, guys!!!   And my order was delivered for me less than the hour! Good job!
I placed an online order, order was taken out of my card only to be canceled and now I have to wait 3 days before my money is back on my card.  Last time I order from you
Soooo good - a little expensive, but the delivery lady was nice and the food was good! Thank god I can get a good pizza here! Delivery takes a while so be patient. Worth the wait.
Tried to order the special that's posted on here and they wouldn't honor it. Not good business. Buyer beware.

Had a craving for pizza so thought I'd give it a try. This location has had some changeover recently and I didn't realize a new place had opened. Went with a two slice special,which was a great value and ended up pleasantly surprised. The pizza was good, tasted fresh and seemed to be made with quality ingredients.

Don't ever order delivery! It took them 2 hours to deliver a salada and a pizza. Not to mention the pizza was nuke warm and floppy when it arrived, like it's been sitting in a hot car. The salad was warm as well. The only good thing that happened when our food finally arrived was the manager took $7.00 off and apologized. 
#manageyourworkersbetter #ivehadbetterpizza

I came here on a Saturday afternoon around 12:15pm. I walk in and there are two young men "working". No greeting, nothing, nada, they continue their conversation. I look around and the place is empty. Just me and the two "workers", sigh. I look on the wall for the menu and specials and I see for $4.99 two slices of cheese or pepperoni pizza and a drink. Bingo! Sounds perfect. I walk up to where the two guys are talking to place my order and I finally get my greeting. So I place my order (2 slices of pizza and a drink) only to be told "We don't have any slices right now". Um what??? This is a PIZZA place right?? There wasn't even a explanation like maybe they were in the oven and would be ready in 15 minutes, just "we don't have any slices right now" I'm sorry but there are hundreds of pizza places in town and I will not be coming back to this one.

Boo! Got a coupon for $10 off an order of $15. I got the coupon at our last order just last month (june 2016). Coupon exp is 7/31/2016 so we thought of using it before expiry.

The man who took my to-go-order said he wont accept the coupon coz it's from the old owner. Duh! It's not like we've had the coupon for ages and it hasn't even expired yet. My total order is $38, more than twice the minimum amount on the coupon  In 30 days they changed mgt and did not bother honoring coupons previously given out. Bad bad customer service.

Today is our 2nd order and we wont be ordering again!

The Philly cheese steak is really good!!! I ordered cheese fries too & they just gave me regular fries that were soggy. So 3 stars still, I will order another time and try something else. 


Update:

I've ordered here a couple more times and I'm disappointed...
Bacon cheeseburger: the burger was good but bacon was not crispy at all
Zeppolis (dessert): really hard & dry 
Bagel with cream cheese: gave me packs of butter instead of cream cheese -______-
I don't get the bad reviews. I've ordered delivery multiple times from this place late night and it's always great. I order the white pizza with pepperoni every time.
Delicious place with friendly people. Ordered something that wasn't on the menu, and they had no problem doing so. Recommend to everyone to try their Philly Cheese Steaks.
Great food, best pizza, always good, fast delivery. If your looking for a good pizza joint this is very recommend.

Service is excellent! Food is excellent! Very friendly and accommodate any size of party. Ordered the Joe's Philly burger and holy cow! Its awesome! 4 dollar cheese pizza on Saturday's and Sunday's have 20 dollar specials! They deliver but it's great just coming in. #SinCityMopar

I've been to Joe's 4x now with friends. Each time we all have tried different items on the menu to try and get something we found that we actually liked. We've tried the pizza, wings, burgers, and Philly cheese steaks. Each time we all left feeling like we didn't want to go back, but it's the kind of location you wish you could.

Pizza - pizza hut quality crust & sauce quality with papa murphy's (frozen pizza) quality toppings. The pizza was a mess. The toppings rolled right off of the pizza and ended up on your plate in a big mess rather than in your mouth. The quality of the toppings were mediocre. We got a supreme pizza (large) and it fed 2 of us but wasn't something I would go back to eat again. You could get a higher quality pizza at a franchised pizza delivery service (for less $$ too) even though we dined in.

Burgers - had a western burger and it was decent. It's not a burger joint but the patty and bun were good. The fries weren't good. On multiple visits we tried the fries and each time we couldn't try more than a couple. They were hot, but the taste was incredibly bland and tasted worse than if they had just used a frozen bag from the supermarket.

Wings - the best thing at Joe's. Well breaded, tangy sauce. Multiple members of the group stated this was consistently the best thing they tried. The only problem was that I wouldn't go to a pizza place to get wings. This is kind of the general problem - too many options on the menu with not enough focus. Is it a pizza place? Deli? Burger Joint?

Service - there are always a lot of employees. They all seem nice enough but almost every time we have been there the staff acts as if they've never taken an order before. Again, the staff is polite but untrained or socially awkward.

Water - we were charged $1 for a cup of tap water and we weren't told about that before we paid for it. If we would have known we would be charged for tap water we would've gotten a soda. 

This is a place I really wish I could like. The people making the food and taking the orders seem very nice. It's also local, so I want it to succeed but it just seems to lack focus around the menu and the ingredient quality. I know this place has (12) 5 star reviews which I think are all from the staff so I wanted to write something realistic to help other yelpers in their food decisions.

Ordered from this place and never again.  Delivery came in over an hour and the driver can't even speak English. Pizza was cold as ice when it came in and caesars salad was blah.  It was not worth the $30.00.  Could have ordered from Domino.

The only reason they didn't get 5 stars is because it took a couples hours to arrive...however they did call us and inform us of the delay and we weren't in a rush...what can you expect after midnight in Vegas. 

We ordered the garlic knots which were absolutely perfect!!! Little crisp, perfectly cooked dough and they were sitting in garlic Parmesan butter! 

We got a Philly cheesesteak. Delicious! Fries were a bit soggy but that was to be expected as it was delivery. Meat lovers pizza had great flavor, good meat n cheese ratio, it was hot. 

My husband and I were extremely surprised at how good our food was....and we are sober so it's not just the alcohol talking. Lol

We will most definitely be ordering again
Extremely rude employee!!! Will never patron this establishment. I hope the owners know how their employees speak to costumers!
Horrible. Pizza was cold and late(took almost 2 hours) and the fries were soggy.  STAY AWAY!!!!

I discovered this place a few weeks ago and can't stay away from it.  Not only is their pizza great but the Joe Philly's Burger is the most unique and delicious burger I have had in Vegas since I moved here a year ago.  The food is lovingly cooked by the owner and you can tell he really has passion for what he does.  The staff are all friendly and you can not beat the fantastic prices.  This is my favorite spot for tasty fast food.

Tried this place after it went under new management. The service was horrible. The entire place was chaotic. After taking our order a worker called out asking everyone in the place what they ordered. Then he shouted an apology for everything being fucked up. 
When the food finally arrived after a very long wait, it was absolutely foul. I could only eat a few bites. This is not the same food the original place served. The roll that the cheese steak was on was burnt. The meat was over done. 
Btw, the first time the cheese steak came out it had to go back. The cheese was not melted.
We tried to order a omelette which was on the menu. This crazy woman said they did not know how to make it.
This place is nasty. STAY AWAY!!!

Warm salad with no dressing and cold pasta are just what I wanted for lunch after a 2 1/2 hour wait.  The lukewarm soup, phillycheese and fries are a disappointment also.  The squashed containers were a nice touch.

Have been here twice and each times has been awesome!

First off the staff is friendly and helpful.  You are immediately greeted as you walk in the door.  The staff is also great at making recommendations and letting you know about the specials they have.  Restaurant is very clean and the staff very attentive.  The last time we where there we got free dessert! Thanks guys!!!!

As for the food, all I can say is I loved it!  Both times I went it was with a group of friends and we ordered pizza.  I have finally found a good pizza place in Vegas!  They focus on making good pizza with out all the frills.   They are generous with the toppings and the pizza crust is well made.  One thing that I really appreciated was the pepperoni they use. The slices of pepperoni are large and it helps to make sure that every bite has a good bit of pepperoni on it. 

Overall if you are looking for good Classic America pizza then this is the place to go.  I will defiantly be going back as I am already craving their pizza again!

This is one of the few places I would order a Philly from, generally speaking because I'm not a Philly fan, but believe me this place has Philly's to kill for. Everything is hand made to order and the amount of fries that came out with the orders was HUGE! Mom, Brother, and Fiancé of mine ordered the Philly cheesesteaks and had enough to take home. I ordered the Chicken Caesar Wrap and it was more than enough plus a small side salad on the side. The owner's wife makes pastries and made cheesecake which was phenomenal as well. If you're lookin for a small place with big flavor food, you've gotta check this place out! Bonus, it's right around the corner from the airport! Excellent food and amazing people running the place!

I ordered baked ziti and wings from here. When I arrived to pick it up, I could smell the pizza and I had to add one to my order. The food is amazing! The staff is really nice, and the service was great!

Tried to have lunch here today. I lived in France for many years and was excited to see Croque Monsieur on the menu. Usually a Ham and Cheese Sandwich oozing with Béchamel and cheese on top. What came out was a ham sandwich with burned wip cream on top. When I asked about it, I was told it is the French version. 
I get that not everybody can cook but I am disappointed by the snotty reply.

Good, tasty, American-style Italian food, and lots of it for surprisingly low prices. The spaghetti with sausage came with two big Italian sausages which were very good, and the dish was accompanied by a dinner salad along with the expected garlic bread. What a deal! We got a supreme pizza (four kinds of meat and several veggies) in the 18-inch extra-large size, and the nice man asked if we wanted it in 8 or 16 pieces. We chose 16 (good move!) and ended up with 7 for leftovers along with a little spaghetti and sausage. This met our late-night dinner requirements so well! The menu offers lots of other choices including breakfast. I'd love to try the Greek salad. :-)

I, like many others, gave this place a shot a handful of times. I tried different things to see if anything was a gem, but no.

Sorry, but this joint just has terrible food. Don't waste your money or time here. And I don't mean average food, I mean really bad, sketchy looking food. 

Avoid. Save yourself the disappointment.

Mozzarella sticks are fire. Awesome pizza quick delivery. Repeat customer also surprised me when they have some of the best gyros I've found in vegas. All around a awesome place to eat and relax or order and eat at home

This used to be one of our favorite spots!!! Apparently it got bought out and now has new owners. They completely changed everything the food, the menu, and the service. Bring back the old owners!!! I know one thing...we WILL NOT be back. There was a special on the front door that we wanted and he said "I don't care what the door says" took off the vegas dog special, the mac n cheese bites, and it was dark and dirty. It sucks being from Chicago it was a little piece of home.

OH.MY.GODDDD.... this is my second time and It's like it got even BETTER than it already had.  The pizza we had was simple and perfect....it had super fresh hand tossed, doughy regular crust.... with a perfectly balanced tomato sauce, gooey-slightly firm milky mozzarella with double pineapple gently swimming in the cheese, settling comfortably into the goo as it cooled from the oven. ....i could write a novel on this glorious pizza my GOD it's the best. And the canoli's....holy hell. Perfection as well... crispy shell and cool sweet cream and chocolate chips inside.  THANK YOU FOR MAKING MY PIZZA DREAMS COME TRUE YOU BEAUTIFUL FREAKING PIZZA SHOP

DONT ORDER DELIVERY. this place took an hour and a half to send 3 pizzas literally one mile down the road. when i called to check on the order they told me it was not their driver and that they had no way of contacting them. I spent the next 20 minutes on hold with grub hub only to figure out it WAS in fact the restaurants  own driver and they could have contacted him the whole time. wouldn't care too much normally however this was for a company lunch and the whole team was standing around waiting for a half hour then had to get back to work so what started as a treat for my tam ended in none of them eating lunch and everybody being pissed. its pizza delivery not rocket science figure it out.

This is some of the worst pizza I have had in a long time it was soggy and tasted disgusting I ordered a supreme pizza I gave this place a try because it had good reviews on Yelp but i 
will not be ordering from here anymore I rather eat little Caesars

Got nothing but a overpriced disappointment.

My friend insisted on upon ordering in Joe Phillys and I went along with having never heard of this place. We ordered a medium meat lovers and a order of chicken wings and fries. Delivery was surprisingly quick, beating their estimate of 45 minutes by 20 minutes.

Unfortunately the pizza was soggy due to the grease from all of the toppings and cheese. We had to put the pizza in the oven but it still didn't fix the problem. The chicken fingers were dry and looked like the came from the freeze section of Costco. The fries were tasteless and under cooked. For the $25 we spent we probably would have been better off going to Pizza Hut.

After ordering hundreds of dollars of delivery in this town the last couple years....I understand you get  what you pay for ... However ...  I have to say I am very disappointed. I did not receive any salad dressing for either salad ordered with my entrees.  Everything is frozen and re-heated and of very poor quality.  None of the condiments requested were included. The marinara on the side for the toasted ravioli was spilled all over the container and therefore useless.  Sauce on the stuffed shells appears to have had meat in it and it was not advertised as such. Yes... After having a single bite and now knowing it's been 20 mins since I tried it- I can say for sure there was meat somewhere in there!!  The mac and cheese was NO DIFFERENT THAN WHAT YOU GET OUT OF KRAFT MAC AND CHEESE BOX!!! 

The marinara was flavorless. I could go on but it's senseless... Don't waste your time unless you're drunk and just want tasteless food at 5am.

I was really in the mood to get a couple of slices of pizza, and had been thinking about where to go, when I remembered that there was a pizza place near the airport.  This is not the same pizza place that was there in the past, but I figured I would give them a shot and go ahead and get something to eat.

When I went into the restaurant, I noticed that it looked similar to what it had looked like under the former name, so made the assumption that the food would still be similar.  I ordered two slice a pizza and a drink along with some fries.  When they told me almost $10 I already started to rethink my order, but was stupid and went ahead and paid anyways. $10 may not seem like a lot, but for a fast food pizza joint in LV, that is more than you should pay unless you are getting really good high quality slices.

I did receive the order quickly, maybe too quickly, which should have been the first sign that speedy service was more important then getting good food.  The French fries tasted like they had been cooked to quickly in oil that wasn't as clean as you want for a good order of fries.  I only ate about half of the fries and then gave up on them (I still have an upset stomach several hours later).  I had figured that I could drown the fries in ketchup, but it was obvious that used a generic brand of ketchup that tasted cheap.

I also received my pizza slices at the same time as the fries, and the first thing that I noticed was that one of the slices looked like a normal size slice, while the other slice looked like it was on the small size, almost like it came from a smaller pizza.  I figured that since I paid the price for an entire pizza, I should at least get two decent size slices, which I didn't (I guess this wasn't important since I ate only part of the second slice and decided it just wasn't worth it, and left).  When I tried the pizza it was very obvious that the slices had been siting around, and they tasted like they had been reheated, but without being even a little crispy, and they had very little flavor.  The pizza also had almost no cheese or pepperoni which put this pizza at the level of a little tony pizza you would buy for about $1.50 in a grocery store.

I would suggest if you see this restaurant, you keep walking, because the food is way overpriced and not very good.

Just wanted to share some love with the staff working on 9/17/15 around 5pm. I was stuck in traffic and realized that there was no way I was making it home with out a trip to the ladies room. I hate when people duck into establishments just to use the facilities. But these two women were life savers. I offered to buy stuff if I needed to but they were so understanding and sweet. I will say it smelled really good inside and from the vibe alone, I will be trying this place out the next time I want some pizza! Customer service can sometimes just be helping someone out. Much appreciated!

I ordered a pizza online and it took 2 1/2 hours to receive my pizza. The delivery driver didn't speak English and had to have an interpreter to receive my directions. Even with that, he was unable to find my location which is a common location found by many other delivery places. The store manager agreed to give me my pizza that was delivered cold and refund my money but the owner who was translating told the driver to take the pizza back. Therefore I was left waiting for a refund to my card and no pizza to eat.
Frozen dinner that was reheated. Don't waste your $. Fried calamari and fish and chips. Only thing Fresh made is probably the pizza so stick to that.
Open 24 hours!!! Not much good choices when you work graveyard but Joe's Philly has really great food.

our 1st time getting food from here tonite .. (ordered thru grubhub) what we got:

-10" thin crust cheese pizza
-20 chicken wangs w/fries
-antipasto salad

food arrived hot/in tact - and everything tasted wonderful!!! my favorite would have to be the salad and i was impressed how crispy the fries were!!!

overall?? pretty freakin good!!

We order from Joe Philly frequently! Sometimes three times a week. The food is never disappointing with reasonable prices. Quality is consistent and delivery times reasonable, even at 3am! Yes 3am. Being in the restaurant business I work late hours and the last thing I want to do is cook when I get home. We've never been disappointed. Hands down the best!

24/7 pizza place close to my work with a tasty sauce and good carry out price. Night staff was quick but not overly friendly. 

I will definitely be back for more.

I get that there fax machines were down. But after waiting 90 minutes for food, I had to call them to inquire. Cancelled my order. Dude told me to " go Fuck yourself" under his breath before hanging up. Great business motto. Btw, fu.

A frozen Red Baron pizza would've been better than this greasy abomination. Bad cheese, hardly any sauce, bad crust. WHY is it so difficult to make a good pizza in Las Vegas??? I never write bad reviews... but this was awful. Just awful. Sorry guys -- step up your game. (I was high as fuck and still couldn't eat this shit!)

RUDE! Pizza was ehhh. Placed order days in advance for a reason and still got horrible customer service. My order was not even that big, under 10 pizzas for pickup and at a certain time as we had a party and were only able to eat at a certain time so we couldn't get it earlier or later then the set time I put on the order. Got a phone call an hour before we were set to pick it up and lady on the phone was rude and not happy we couldn't pick up our planned ahead order an hour early, I explained to her very nicely that we couldn't because it would just sit here for an hour and get cold and we don't want cold pizza. She was huffing and puffing, telling me that they had a HUGE private party that they had to make pizza for. I'm sorry, 1st off that's not my problem, I planned ahead. 2nd off, sounds like you all need better planning. Not sure why you would make my pizzas a head of time and expect me to get them and get mad at me when I can't. You could have called me sooner and you didn't. When my husband and friend picked up the barely warm pizzas she was very rude to them and the HUGE party was like 10 people. Not sure if she was just having a bad day or not but she has now lost our business and we have another big party planned in the same area later this year where we will need pizzas and will no longer be using them. Seeing as we used them the year before as well. Shame. One bad apple ruins the bunch sometimes.

Best tasting pizza in town along with their phillies! No need to drive to Philadelphia lol you got bomb ones right here. 
Quick and friendly service! Even when you order out it take about 30-40 to deliver. 
Try it you won't regret it! 

Thank me later :)

Wait I almost forget the spaghetti! It's amazing

Pretty good pizza at pretty good prices. We ordered a mushroom pizza and some other appetizers and enjoyed the quality. It's more of a takeout spot than a dine in spot though they have a couple booths to eat in should you want to.
This place has great food and service. Highly recommended for lunch and dinner!!!! Their pizza and sandwiches are amazing especially the Philly cheese steak is very good.

I usually order takeout here. Always amazing. They have such a wide selection of food. From salads to pizza and pasta.Love this place, a great find for the locals and everyone. The owner is super caring  They Are Out Of There Way Friendly.Well, lets talk about the delicious pizza. My favorite has to be the buffalo chicken pizza. It's the right amount of crunchy and gooey to satisfy that pizza need. But they have so many different flavors for your satisfaction.Last time my husband had the wings and he is extremely picky about wings. He said they were some of the best he has had. I eat there regularly because the food is so delicious and fresh you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu.

The pastry they back here is the best and taste great...a taste of the true Italian flavor!
Bravo new management!

5/5 The pizza is unbelievable. I usually don't write reviews but it's worth giving this place a try. It's  hidden away next to mccaron airport across sunset park. The Philly cheese steak is one of my top 3 favorite in Las Vegas. There delivery is always fast and efficient.

1. Close to my house.
2. Good pizza.
3. Really good cheesesteaks. Best in town? Maybe. Best in SE Vegas? Yes.
4. Amazing prices. Got the weekend special - $3.99 large cheese pizza. $7.99 cheesesteak with drink.
5. Friendly service.

If they had a couple tvs up for watching games, and offered a few craft beers, it would be amazing.

The worst customer service in the world and from someone that claims to be a manager! The driver was sweet and helpful, but that manager was and is a jack-ASS! If I called and said you got my order wrong can you send me what I ordered please and you can have this pizza you sent back. Why why why do I have to argue with you in the phone and how do you mess up a persons order and it's in black and white pepperoni pizza nothing more nothing less why did I get extra pineapple and ham I don't eat pork! And I don't want any sweet pizza and then you block my number! I haven't drank not an ounce of liquor I can understand if I was drunk and ordering but no! You all messed my order up and did absolutely nothing to accommodate your error never order from here I'll stick to secret pizza and to top it off I go to eat a slice and the pizza I burned on the whole bottom eff that if I could leave a visual middle finger here you go! Never again!

This restaurant is new to Las Vegas and absolutely delicious. Once they get known a little more, they could def Win the review journal's Best in Vegas award! You gotta check it out! Wide variety of food available. Nice thin crust pizza that's full of toppings and flavor! Best Philly Cheese Steak in town! Really glad we found this place. They deliver in their area, too! Really friendly staff as well.

I've tried Joe's Philly several times after I received a menu on my door a few months ago. I have to say I've had better, but it's a decent place to grab a cheap, quick lunch.

I'm not sure why it's called "Joe's Philly's Pizza" as that seems kind of confusing. Are they about the pizza? Are they about the Philly Cheesesteak? I didn't know that Philadelphia was known for their pizza.

Anyway, in three visits, I've ordered their cheesesteak twice and it was pretty good. I've eaten a lot of cheesesteak sandwiches in my life - I would have to say this ranked somewhere in the middle to lower spectrum. However, the lunch special comes with fries and a fountain drink for around $6. I do have to comment that the fries were pretty soggy and under salted. The sandwich itself is not bad, it could use more meat, cheese and onions and peppers. The bread was decent as well.

I've also gotten the chicken wings. The wings were actually pretty good. Not the best I've had, but definitely not the worst. The amount of buffalo sauce really varies. Sometimes they've smothered the wings and other times there's hardly been any on them. Either way, I think it tastes just like Jack's Hot Sauce, so I'll just put that on if I go back again.

The service is pretty quick. They usually have your order to you within 10 minutes (usually less). All in all, it's not a bad place, but fairly mediocre. I'll have to try the pizza  if I go there again.

Decided to go to Joe's and never been. The food is amazing! Great specials. Totally worth the drive! Not only is the food great, but the service is fantastic....Don't forget to come here, you won't lose.

Its been about a month since the last time I ordered anything from here. I ordered about 3 times in about a month or two, and then pretty much gave up. I saw some really good reviews about this place, and was excited thinking finally I can get some good pizza. First time I tried it I said to myself that it was ok, maybe it was a fluke. Second time it was kind of the same thing. Funny, I even tried a third time and uh, well, its not good. There's nothing good about this place in my opinion. I think that it is almost impossible that this place has a single legit 5 star review. The people seem very friendly over the phone so its not like I'm venting over a bad experience or anything like that. Its just the food is not even really average. From the pizza, to the wings, to the cheesesteak. I tried quite a few things just hoping that it would be at least decent so I could have a convenient place to order from, and no luck. I wont be ordering from here again, and right now I'm looking at a bunch of 2 star reviews here on the screen about this place, and they are really accurate. It is kind of irritating to me that I think this place had like 10+ reviews total that all gave them 5 stars. Not a single 4 or less star review, and the food is really below average. Not cool.
Had their take-out pizza which was just fantastic! The amount of sauces and spices were just perfect, and the ingredients were very fresh. I can't rate the pizza high enough, was great.
Super friendly and welcoming. Smells delicious. How can you go wrong with a Philly pizza. Mmm mmm mmm. Bring it on!

the delivery was fine. calamari was clearly frozen and reheated, the mushrooms were too. the hawaiian pizza tasted... strange? like the dough was a dessert dough. also the website lists the hawaiian as ham with pineapple, but it was in fact ham, pineapple, AND bacon, which would've been fine, if i knew i was getting it or, you know, liked bacon. i was feeling relieved that we also got some desserts. my boyfriend's "chocolate cake", or a chocolate loaf as it was, was sunken in and quite stale. i was so excited for the cheesecake but WOW it tasted like it was 10 years old, had absolutely no flavor. it was on a red sauce that i can only describe as tasting like grenadine. so yeah, i spit it out and threw it away. i will say though, the mountain dew was EXCEPTIONAL.

Let me just start off by saying that it took them almost TWO HOURS to deliver a pizza and chicken tenders and when I called for and update the man said the driver would be at my house in "5 minutes" well 30 minutes later the guy finally arrived with a nice cold pizza. Aside from that the food was no more than alright. Please do yourself a favor and DON'T ORDER FROM THIS PLACE.
The new owners remodelled nicely .... However the food that was decent before is mediocre now at least. Chicken Noodle soup broth was sour and the fries fried beyond a crisp.
One of my favorite pizza places in town! If you havn't already, you must try the Armenian Pizza' Great place

I'd probably be able to rate my order a bit higher HAD IT BEEN FRESH. My order took almost an hour and a half to arrive. The pizza was cold and hard, the calamari was soggy, and I couldn't even tell the zeppoli was zeppoli. I called to ask where my order was and the woman who ordered seemed put out that I asked stating her driver had left ten minutes previous. After I received my order, I called again. Same woman. Bad attitude. They offered to send me another order. Why would I as a customer (who has already waited way too long) want to have to wait more? If the pizza was outstanding, the wait might be worth it. It is average pizza. I will never order from here again. I was refunded $10 on my order. I should have been refunded all of my money for this crap. Food is not worth it.

UPDATE: the OWNER messaged me and called me "sir." Also saying that they were on the phone. If they had been on the phone, my gender would have been obvious. Also saying it takes 40 minutes to make a Sicilian pizza and that they hope that I understand THAT. I am not stupid. I am, however, Sicilian.  They said the driver left as soon as the pizza was done. An obvious lie because it only takes 10 minutes to get to the damn store. The pizza would not be cold. Do not order from these liars.

Ate there first and last time I will ever eat there. I'm all for giving new small businesses a chance but never again will I give this place a chance no one wore gloves and hair nets I ended up pulling out a hair out of my food I myself have short hair not medium length brown hair.  Worst part was I already ate almost 2 slices before finding it.

They stay open super late at night but unlike most places, they serve really good food. I ordered the philly cheese steak sandwich and it was delicious! Beef was tender and thought it was saucy, it wasn't overwhelming. Hubby is a picky eater and he gobbled the philly up. Definitely recommended and if ever in the area, I would come by and get a philly cheese again.
We love this pizza place best in las vegas. Eat hear few times a month and never let down

"Meh. I've experienced better." sums up my experience with the place. I've been here a few times and have tried a couple of different items and have pretty much had the same experience each time.

The Goods: Friendly service, decent wings & good crust & sauce on the pizza. 

The Not-So-Goods:

It's kind of hard for me to pin-point what exactly is wrong with this place. The servers are friendly, but they don't seem to know what can and can't be done. Example: I ask for a small cup of water and here is what I was replied with the times I asked - 1) Grab a bottle of water and it should be fine. 2) Sure, here's a cup and you can use the fountain. 3) Ok, I will give you a cup but be sure not to fill it up with soda...AND THEY THEY CHARGED ME FOR FOUNTAIN SODA ANYWAY (I didn't realize until after I paid). 

To continue with the lack of consistency, even though we eat in every single time, we are often brought out food already boxed up as if we ordered pick-up or delivery. One time once we ordered a pizza, the server walked out with the pizza in the box without any plates or utensils (you might ask why utensils...read later). At least attempt to cater towards your dine-in visitors. 

Lets talk about the pizza. I am a major pizza enthusiast and I don't believe there is a such thing as a bad pizza. But I've never been more disappointed with a pie in such a long time.

I tried the supreme pizza and outside of the crust and sauce...everything was such a complete hope mess. It just seemed like they threw on numerous frozen vegetables, and then caked a lot of cheese on the top of the toppings and assumed that was it.  The peppers, and onions weren't fully cooked and the toppings were so heavy, I could barely even hold a slice without all of the cheese and toppings falling off. This is why having utensils would be nice so I can at least some pieces and eat the pizza with the cheese and toppings in one bite.

This pizza would be somewhat passable if they only delivered, but if I'm dining in, I would expect some kind of quality increase since the pizza would generally be fresher. I severely question the reviews that say this is the best pizza in town. I understand that this is a local establishment, but that doesn't mean it should get favorable reviews for unfavorable flavors. 

Is this better than Digorno? Nope
Is this better than Little Caesars? Sorry...but not really. I like LC though, but why would I come to a place that has lower quality pizza for double the price of LC ($8 for a supreme)?

Despite the fact that some of their other food is decent (mainly the wings), I place a heavy weight on the pizza itself. I really wanted this to be a great place, but #soniamdissapoint.

It just seems like they are on the cusp of making a damn good pizza, hopefully they take actual criticism and will make proper adjustments. If anyone is wondering why am I so critical of the pizza, it's because it's a pizzeria.

#idonotproofreadsomyreviewsmightsoundlikegibberish

This pizza has stood the test of Las Vegas' time for f here today gone tomorrow. As so many chain restaurants have pushed for small businesses out Joe Philly's has been here since the first time I moved to vegas in the early 90's and is just as good now as they were then if not better!!!

Just Ordered a hawaiian pizza . It was still warm and delicious.  Also ordered a cheeseburger  which was also hot and delicious.   Will definitely be ordering from here . This pizza was better than pizza Hut and dominoes.   The fries were a fail. But everything else was just right.  Didn't exceed my expectations but definitely met them ..

I only give this place one star based on they delivery late night. Wouldn't think they were too busy to mess up at 4am!!  They don't answer the calls took 2hours to deliver 2miles .. when the food came it was cold as hell! I ate half the sandwich an tried The fries  I couldn't even eat them! A total waste of money for the food  ugh waste of time and my appetite. I ordered a Philly cheese sandwich (never again) I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone let alone the delivery service or customer support! I called a billion times when they answer led they said my food was cooking. Then took another hour to get it to me .. take it from me I hardly ever complain. Don't waste your money go somewhere else. Trust me. $20 for that seriously
Wish I could rate the food but this place cancelled my grubhub order with no explanation an hour after it was placed.

We stopped in here for a slice on our way back to our hotel and it was just ok.  I lived in Philly for 6 years and I've had some great pizza, this place was kind of disappointing one this night.  The staff were not very friendly or helpful and acted like you were bothering them.  

I guess being open later then some places you get a lot of people wondering in and since people tend to order something, they don't have to go out of their way to be friendly or helpful.

The pizza was more dough then pizza, it was almost like eating a pretzel with sauce on it.  I ordered a sausage slice and they were not very generous with the sausage, it was mostly a cheese slice but with the sausage price.

I would not go back to this place when in Philly again, there are way to many pizza places to have to return to this one.  It also could have just been the staff there on this particular night, so its hard to say.  The best suggestion I can give is to stop in, grab a slice and post a review.  Maybe I just hit them on an off night which happens.

This place is off the chain. I don't get why there are less STARS. 

I'm new to Vegas. And was looking for a good pizzeria. I also love Philly Cheese Steak sandwiches. But damn, this place got a Philly cheese steak pizza. Ohf. Def had to try it out.

So I ordered online and waited for only a bit... 30 min roughly, just like any other pizza deliveries. I think his name was Mike(totally forgot his name), Big chunky dude. Guy was super nice AF. 

He rolled up and gave me my meal... He heads out, I go in... And damn, this pizza was legit... I ate the whole thing in one sitting... Along with a chocolate cake I ordered with it...(also filling AF...) 

Ohf. Y'all just gotta try it out. Rec'd on top.
I only had two slices of pepperoni for lunch, but it was excellent.  Awesome tasting thin crust with a great chew, nice amount of toppings and plenty of sauce.  Very good.

Extra! Extra! Read all About It: Joe Philly's Is One of the few Places Serving Pizza Burgers! 

   Both Eastern Avenue and Sunset Road make news for the hot new restaurants and coffee houses that border the two thoroughfares. What has been kept out of the news is that at the corner of Eastern Avenue and Sunset is that there is a pizzaria that is one of the few and possibly only place in the southeast Valley to pick up a pizza burger. 

  What is a pizza burger? The pizza burger is the marriage of pizza and hamburger. It is a hamburger that is topped off with mozzarella cheese and pizza sauce. Although the pizza burger is rare in Las Vegas, it is a common staple of the family owned diners that are popular in the New York metropolitan area. They are so uncommon in Las Vegas that this pizza burger was the very first one that I ate in Las Vegas since relocating here in 2004.

  It wasn't the pizza burger that brought me to this pizzaria tucked in a strip mall in back of a McDonald's and across from Sunset Park. When I stepped inside on February 24, my intention was to try their pizza and check out their menu. If you know me, you know that what I like more than pizza is the eggplant parmagaina sub that some pizzarias serve. Joe Philly's apparently isn't one of them. However they have a good size menu that includes combinations displayed on the door and window. On my first visit, I'd try their two pizza slice special. 

   Their two pizza slice special goes for $4.99. The special includes a fountain Pepsi. When I paid Angela at the register, I noticed a sign that says if you check in on Yelp you get either a free cold beverage, coffee, or slice of pizza. This would come in handy for the pizza burger. Before discussing the pizza, I will write that Angela was the employee that I dealt with both times. After paying her for the food, a few minutes later she brought it to the table. Her attitude was good. Just like Angela's attitude, the slices of pizza were good. 

  Exactly a week later, I returned for my debut Las Vegas pizza burger. I paid Angela $8.99 plus tax for a pizza burger with fries. By telling her that I was checking in on Yelp, the fountain Pepsi was on them. After paying, I returned to one of the sundry of tables opposite the counter. Later I would step into the extra room to photograph a mural depicting a journey from Chicago to Las Vegas. This is one of my pictures below. Now a few of my pictures below are of the pizza burger. The Joe Philly's pizza burger just like their pizza is good. Being that it is so difficult to find a pizza burger in Las Vegas, I am content with a good pizza burger. The dripping mozzarella cheese and pizza sauce over a hamburger patty between two buns brought back memories of the pizza burgers that I have enjoyed in the New York diners. 

  Although this place is called Joe Philly's, in my book it is Joe New York's. When I ate their pizza burger it simply put me in a New York State of Mind.

Very nice business owners, the pizza resembles Pizza Hut (super soft crusts), but more value because it is cheaper. They have a great weekend special $3.99 for a large cheese pizza. Also, their cheese steak specials automatically include fries and a canned soda, which makes it a great value for under $10 dollars. 

The owners of this place are very nice people. Will definitely come back for more!

My favorite joe philly steak sandwich, fries n cold Pepsi.  I kept coming back to this place, Angela is nice and kind.  One time, I ordered by phone then picked up the food but my fave fries is different I came back to ask them, this young guy I asked was annoying, he said that's what we got I can't do anything about it.... his face like unsympathetic bec I'm upset he keeps laughing and not apologizing.  The next time I returned, he learned to be civilized to their customer.

Horrible service!  I would give them no star if it's an option! The person who took my order probably NEVER took it because I waited for over 1.5 hours! He said I should get my food in one hour.  Such a liar!  After the fourth call, I told the guy to cancel my order. Then within 2 mins the front desk called and said the pizza guy was down stairs.   It's a freaking joke! I ordered the pizza on a freaking Monday!  It shouldn't have taken almost two hours to deliver the food! The guy could've told me from the beginning but he lied and said one hour!!  I only gave one star bc the pizzas were good.

1st time using these guys since I forgot to bring my lunch in for work. Called in and ordered a 2-topping pizza w/2 liter soda special. Man answering phone very friendly and good customer service. Placed order for chicken & mushroom (since they had no spinach) but they had no Alfredo or white sauce available, using just white cheese and the toppings. Thats fine becuase i was just hungry. He said it would be 45 min before it would arrive and I got it in like 20-25. Super quick service for a Saturday as I was starving. Crust was good. Pizza arrived hot and soda pop cold.  I prefer a very thin crust but was impressed they didn't skimp in cheese. Very reasonable price and I think I'd like to try more of their offerings despite some of the unfavorable review by a few. Good first impression for delivery service.
First timer. Staff was very friendly. Food was really good. Portions were above average. Great specials. Definitely return when we are back in town. :)
Put on hold two separate times for ten minutes and told my food will be on the way. It wasn't. I'm still waiting.
Yummy yummy everything was great! Cheese steak was great and they have baklava!! The fries are really good, and I'm picky about my fries. Thanks guys, didnt try the pizza but i will next time.

Damn good pizza & fries. The first place that I have been to that offers ranch or catsup & that's why the 5 stars. The cheese was real good & they didn't skimp on it. As strange as it sounds crispy fries are a challenge for some but they hit it. The staff was nice too. They are open 24 hours & they deliver. We ordered around 3am and all was good.

Typical pizzeria menu choices. Price is good and quality of food is not bad. Ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and garlic knots with a 2 liter iced tea. Got my food right but waited almost 2 hours for my food. Not during rush hour either. Additionally I got a 2 liter Mtn Dew instead of my iced tea.
Best hands down east coast style pizza you can get in Vegas 24/7 thier always the best customer service around no matter the day and time

Discovered this gem by accident when a coworker shared her pizza.  Sooo surprisingly delicious! The sauce had good flavor, crust was thick, soft, and yummy.  Prices are great for the quality. Oh and they are open all night! I just wish they offered breakfast pizza since they are open during bfast hrs.

GREAT FOOD; BAD DELIVERY SERVICE!!!!

The only reason they are getting three stars is because the food is really good. Their calzones are very good and are full of ingredients not like other pizzerias. However, their delivery drivers apparently don't like to deliver. Both times they parked in front of my building and expected me to go all the way to their car. What happened to the delivery guy knocking at your door to actually deliver your pizza.
I ordered their Pesto pizza delivery and it was wonderful, lots of chicken and feta. The only problem is that it wasn't particularly hot when it arrived, but I hope it was only a one-time thing.

We came into town late and wanted to see what was open and JoePhiilysPizza was so we gave it a shot ! And let me tel you the pizza is so good you'll want to eat your finger with it and we also got a philly cheese steak and that was also good and came with fries and drink ! Would recommend to friends and family good food and family environment!

I go here at least once a week never have I got one dish that was bad (AND I HAVE TRIED EVERYTHING) lol. They making you feel like family and go out the way to give you THE BEST FOOD EVER. I'm telling you pick a pizza any pizza and it will be good. The Philly cheese steak even better. Just a regular bacon cheeseburger it was better then any place I ever been to   if I could give them more then five stars I would. Try it you will in joy it

this place is awesome the food is good and the customer service is top notch. i have always enjoyed people treating me well and that goes very far for me. this place could not be better. does not even matter who is behind the counter they are all awesome people. definitely a place worth your time any time of the day.

This pizza is very mediocre, and looks like a blind drunk assembled it. I also asked for parmesan and chili pepper. . . they didn't come. The up side is that it is edible, and was open at 10 pm on a thursday. So that's nice. I am really surprised that this place got 4.5 stars. I am assuming that most of the people who eat here either don't get pizza, or are drunk. I would order from here again if I had no options though. So take that info however you like.

2 thumbs up! Just ordered from here for the first time and was very pleased! Had the Philly Cheese Steak sandwich and Supreme Pizza and both were excellent! The food was delivered very hot and tasty and even tho a little pricey with the delivery charge I still will most definently order from them again!

Stopped in here for the first time last week, and we really enjoyed the food.

We ordered a cheesesteak, and the chicken tenders with fries. 

Service was super: the girl at the counter, Devina, was super friendly, and offered suggestions when we weren't sure what we wanted.

Food came out quickly, and was delicious. 
The chicken fingers were not greasy, and were breaded well...and there were TONS of them!!!  Seriously, that was a lot of chicken.  The fries were addictive.  

The cheesesteak was excellent as well.  Not "The best" as the sign outside claims, but definitely up there!

I'd be glad to stop in again, now that I know where they are, this could be a regular stop on our disc golf days!

Seriously one of the best late night stops to make. I work as a performer in bars and clubs and am always on the look out for good late night eats. This place is awesome. The food is delicious and the staff is more than accommodating. The location is a little tucked away from the street but it is worth the hunt to find this prize of a eatery. We ordered the Italian special (sandwich fries and a drink), and the Philly cheese steak sandwich (sandwich fries and a drink) My girlfreind said her Philly cheese steak was how she remembered as a kid and have been searching for that taste for as long as I have known her. So....we will definitely be back. My sandwich was delicious with the portions being more food than I could eat, AND at a great price! Seriously one of the best late night stops to make.

Placed order through Grubhub for delivery, quoted 50-60 minutes for delivery. 45 minutes after order, restaurant calls and says it will take another hour to hour and 15 minutes to finish order. Do we want to do it? Hungry family - not waiting over two hours for some pizza and a couple of sandwiches. Called Grubhub and cancelled right away. What a joke. Would keep it moving.

I ordered the family Spaghetti and Meatballs and 2 16 in pizzas. The delivery driver was more than an hour late. I called twice and was told he was on his way. No apologies. I called GrubHub and filed a complaint. Was on the phone with GrubHub and the Mgr named Tony. For more than 40mins. GrubHub did their job and helped me. But Tony did not. He said he would give me store credit good for next order. I'm like the food was cold, nasty and the driver was more than an hour late. I said take credit off this order. He said no because he is not the owner. But your the mgr. Tony still said no. I'm like what kind of service is this. Never again.

Super friendly people. Walked in and my pizza was just coming out. They made sure I got paper plates, parmesan, red peppers, and that i was happy. You can tell they wanted to make sure I was satisfied with my order. Got home and the pizza was great. Exactly what I had wanted. Nothing special about the pizza, but it was a good pizza, and trust me, there is some bad pizza out there. 

Would definitely recommend if youre looking for pizza that isnt too expensive but still want a good slice.

Best pizza I've had in a LONG TIME. Always fast delivery...but honestly, my Roomie and I have tried a LOT of delivery places through an app and this was the most professional, the yummiest...and OMIGOD they actually got my order right...WHAAAAAA? We decided to make this the only joint we order from, from now on.
Pizza delivery arrive after 1 hour (takes about 10-15 minutes MAX to make a pizza) and the pizza arrived cold as well !!
i disagree with the negitive reveiws. food is fresh and tastes great freindly staff and their sunday special is a super value.

The customer service in this place, ESPECIALLY from Vonda, was absolutely the worst I've received while living here in LV. 

After picking up our order, which 2 of the 3 items were wrong, and we drive 20 minutes just to eat here, we're told "No, we can't make you something else until we see the food." We asked that our food be refunded, "No, not until the manger/owner gets here." Another 20 minutes. "How would I know you're not lying about the wrong food." -Vonda

*Update*
The owner shows up. Him and I have a very pleasant, productive conversation about how I was treated as a customer. He offered to come my meal, a discount, or a pizza. I told him, "I don't want a discount, or my meal comped, all I wanted was to let you know how I was treated by the person that is representing you and your business behind this counter." 

He apologized profusely, and we shook hands! 

I have nothing to complain about food wise, this place is GREAT! However, if she's behind the counter, they might struggle getting returning customers.

Homerun. As good as it gets. I order thru grubhub and am never disappointed. Tonight my order was 20 minutes earlier than they originally told me. Food fantastic. They make em thin crust or hand tossed, your choice. What a great place. My new favorite!!!!

This place is really good!!! And they make everything. Seems very family owned and operated and everyone here is very nice and makes you feel like family. Great food and great service. 5 stars for sure!
Pizza was good. Not east coast quality but as close as you would expect. Great sauce and cheese ratio, crust was the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.

Absolutely awful food. I ordered calamari, mozzarella sticks, wings with fries, zeppolis and a cannoli.
Portions were so minimal especially the calamari. The food was cold and disgusting. Not fresh at all. Everything tasted like it was heated in a microwave. Chewy and gross! Took an hour and a half to receive...wouldn't doubt if the driver was snacking based on the tiny portions we received.

The philly cheese steak was excellent , I had no complaints , they followed the requests exactly and that was key for me, I don't like a lot of onions or peppers . Definitely recommend trying. Im hoping the other items are as good as the philly cheese steak.

This is a Fantastic Take Out Spot! 
This restaurant seemed to pop up out of nowhere, as I have lived near this plaza for quite some time. The first time I saw it I had to give it a try.
What a find!
They overload the pizza with delicious cheese and toppings, way more generous than your go to cheap pizza place, and definitely more generous than Pizza Hut and dominoes. 
You'll be pleasantly surprised to find that these chefs also have a variety of dishes they manage to make extraordinarily scrumptious. Many of the appetizers and appetizer-esque dishes are top notch for a kick back with friends.
This reviewer recommends at least trying the pizza on for size and definitely coming back to sample the rest.

We ordered a cheese pizza, chicken parm and zepoles. After being 15 mins late from the confirmed time the driver forgot our drink in the car (no big deal), we checked the bag to make sure everything else was there. When we opened the box the pizza was cold. And we saw that the zepoles looked dry through the plastic top. Opened it and popped one in my mouth and it had no sugar... No taste... Just oiled dough. The sauce that we asked for was not in the bag and once the driver returned we called the store to ask for the sauce. The guy on the phone said that the driver had forgotten it and that basically there's nothing he can do. My husband asked for the money back and the guy on the phone said we had to get it back from grub hub, we ordered from yelp, in cash. Even the driver couldnt understand why he wouldnt just give us back cash. Not too mention he didn't know how much the zepoles cost! We were on the phone with this man debating on the price and that its in cash and to give us back the $4. Never ordering here again. That driver should have never been blamed for the mistake of the store.
Delicious food!!!! Amazing pizza & the Philly Cheese Steak is just to die for!!!! And their delivery guys are always on time.

Man, the pizza was so juicy and delicious that I can't stop finishing it before it gets cold. They are so quick for that quality pizza. They are excellent and way better than those corporate pizza shops.
Super dank! Cheap and quick. I don't know what else to say

The customer service was excellent. I placed an order for delivery. I ordered chili cheese fries and a garden salad. The fries were okay because the chili had beans. I should've asked but most places don't have chili with beans. I  will order from here again but something else. If you like chili with beans you'll like the fries.
